qas.question: What was the response of  Kliment Voroshilov in regards to further conversations with Britain and France?
Who should accept the annexation of Poland?
By accepting the deal with the USSR, Hitler admitted that it prevented what?
What was the response of Kliment Voroshilov in regards to no further conversations with Britain and France?
What was the response of Kliment Voroshilov in regards to further conversations without Britain and France?
Who shouldn't accept the annexation of Poland?
Who should deny the annexation of Poland?
By rejecting the deal with the USSR, Hitler admitted that it prevented what?

context: The day after the Pact was signed, the French and British military negotiation delegation urgently requested a meeting with Soviet military negotiator Kliment Voroshilov. On August 25, Voroshilov told them "[i]n view of the changed political situation, <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>no useful purpose<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> can be served in continuing the conversation." That day, Hitler told the British ambassador to Berlin that the pact with the Soviets prevented Germany from <a2_0><b7_0>facing a two front war<b7_0/><a2_0/>, changing the strategic situation from that in World War I, and that <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>Britain<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> should accept his demands regarding Poland.
